alert.note: Alert for Mississippi (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 12:02PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Mississippi, southern Pemiscot, southeastern Dunklin, northwestern Dyer and southwestern Lake Counties through 1230 PM CDT... At 1202 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gosnell, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blytheville, Caruthersville, Gosnell, Hayti, Steele, Cooter, Heloise, Holland, Ayers, Calumet, Hathaway, Tennemo, Number Nine, Boothspoint, Big Boy Junction, Huffman, Mengelwood, Yarbro, Tylersville and West Hermondale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...southeastern Missouri...and west Tennessee.
